page.title: 04AROUND SHERE 2
page.content: The White Horse Public House makes very much a central attraction in the Square. It was built in 1500 and it probably became an inn at the end of the 17th century. Look out for the stocks in the front garden, a fairly recent addition. Pantrys is a 300 year old house in Shere Square. It is called Pantrys because Mr Pantry, who was the village Registrar of Births and Deaths lived here at the beginning of this century. The house has been added to several times and the outhouse is now being converted into a breakfast room. Opposite our school is Seaforth Cottage which was built in 1632, more than 350years ago,but it still looks very much as it was 125 years ago. Today Seaforth maintains its cottagey style with a cobbled path and leaded light windows and small doorways.
